titles: The approoued order of martiall discipline with euery particuler offycer his offyce and dutie: with many other stratagemes adioyning to the same. Whereunto is adioyned a second booke, for the true ordering and imbattelling of any number so euer, with the proportions of euery battell, which best serueth in these our dayes of seruice. Newlie written by Gyles Clayton.
author: Clayton, Gyles.
Clayton, Gyles. A briefe discourse, of martial discipline.
publisher: By I. C[harlewood] for Abraham Kitsonne, dwelling in Paules Church yarde, at the signe of the Sunne,
notes: In two books. The first book is a revised and enlarged edition of Clayton, Gyles.  A briefe discourse, of martial discipline (STC 5377).

The second book has a separate title page (p. 47) that reads: The second part. with a kalender, contayning the square of any number, for one hundred, to ten 1000. seruing for the ordering of iust squares, bastard squares, and broade squares: and most sufficient for the imbattailing of any number .. . Pagination is continuous.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
keywords: Military art and science --  England --  Early works to 1800.
